intro: Hedyotis acuminata f. quadricosta, commonly known as the four-costate bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. It is native to regions of Asia, including China, India, and Southeast Asia, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Hedyotis acuminata f. quadricosta is often found in forests, shrublands, and along stream banks, where it contributes to the understory vegetation.
